{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3086648,"name":"","username":"crazrRobot123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crazrrobot123/{size}/211176_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-04T20:10:55.448Z","cooked":"

Hi CD

Now that FIRST announced the use of AprilTags for robot vision in the field, I am aware that higher performance will be needed to process the images and not lose FPS.

So I’m trying to figure out on how to install PhotonVision on a Jetson Nano.

I hope someone can help me, thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-04T20:10:55.448Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1264,"reads":393,"readers_count":392,"score":6398.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33648,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3086655,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-04T20:17:52.166Z","cooked":"

They have pretty great documentation on their website

PhotonVision Documentation

Installing PhotonVision

Because we support several co-processors, there are many ways that you can install PhotonVision, based on the co-processor that you are using. For teams using a Raspberry Pi, we have created a Pi i...

BUT, they don’t recommend nor officially support a Jetson Nano.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-04T20:17:52.166Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":394,"readers_count":393,"score":208.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/getting-started/installation/coprocessor-image.html#other-debian-based-co-processor-installation","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Installing PhotonVision - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":216}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/2","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086656,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-04T20:23:34.292Z","cooked":"

Yes, the two primary challenges would be:

A) Building the native libraries for Jetson
B) leveraging the hardware to its fullest capiabilities.

I’m not sure to what extent A is done - I’ve not worked on a Jetson before and am not sure if the linux builds that exist within photonvision will work. Specifically, the apriltag, cscore, wpilib math, and network tables dependencies will be the big things to be looking into.

I’m sure that B has not been broached yet. PhotonVision does not have support for leveraging hardware acceleration on a Jetson.

For alternatives… April Tags — ISAAC 2020.1NX documentation may be of interest?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-04T20:23:34.292Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":35,"reads":380,"readers_count":379,"score":286.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.nvidia.com/isaac/archive/2020.1nx/packages/perception/doc/apriltags.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"April Tags — ISAAC 2020.1NX documentation","clicks":63}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3086663,"name":"Banks T","username":"bankst","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bankst/{size}/172992_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-04T20:37:04.319Z","cooked":"

WPILib is already built for aarch64 targets, so in theory it should “just work”. I haven’t touched a Nano in a long time, so YMMV.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-04T20:37:04.319Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":355,"readers_count":354,"score":226.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"Banks T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24617,"username":"gerthworm","name":"Chris Gerth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27377,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PhotonVision Lead & Developer"},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/4","custom_user_title":"PhotonVision Lead & Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3087916,"name":"Ian2","username":"spacepenguine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-10-11T04:31:35.641Z","cooked":"

The stable version install script for Debian systems (assuming that you’re using the jetson-nano-jp461-sd-card-image.zip Ubuntu 18.04 image) works almost out of the box. You’ll need to apt-get install curl first.

USB camera work out of the box. HW support does not (expected) and CSI / MIPI cameras don’t work out of the box. The later would need integration with the Jetson libraries since this part of the pipeline is completely different on Jetson as compared with RPi.

I’ve got some more notes in a doc that I can prep to share if wanted, though we’re probably not pursuing Jetson Nano much more for this right now.

(Oops this was meant to be a general reply.)

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-11T04:33:36.088Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":110.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"Ian2","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/getting-started/installation/other-coprocessors.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Other Debian-Based Co-Processor Installation - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":38}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":27377,"username":"bankst","name":"Banks T","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bankst/{size}/172992_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14787,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 5026 Mentor | FRC 226 Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/5","custom_user_title":"FRC 5026 Mentor | FRC 226 Alumnus","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3088032,"name":"Banks T","username":"bankst","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bankst/{size}/172992_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-11T16:39:30.325Z","cooked":"

All your findings line up with my last experience on a Jetson. Of note is the Nano and TK1 / TX1/2 boards will be losing software support from Nvidia soon, and aren’t worth pursuing further efforts on IMO.
A Pi4 will run circles around a Nano unless the Nano’s GPU is being used.
The Orin Nano will be a good starter platform for more powerful vision than Pi platforms once it is available. I still plan on adding hardware support for Jetson platforms in the future but simply didn’t get time to do so this year.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-11T16:39:30.325Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":275,"readers_count":274,"score":85.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"Banks T","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14787,"username":"spacepenguine","name":"Ian2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c67d28/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27377,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PhotonVision Lead & Developer"},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/6","custom_user_title":"PhotonVision Lead & Developer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3088199,"name":"Smtopps","username":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-12T00:06:12.902Z","cooked":"

I realize it may be too expensive for most but I am curious if something like the Arduino Portenta would run photon and furthermore if it would work with the vision shield. Another product would be the Arduino Nicla vision although it would need a Ethernet port.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-12T00:06:12.902Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":89.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"Smtopps","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33408,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3088218,"name":"marshall","username":"marshall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marshall/{size}/167657_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-12T01:09:00.013Z","cooked":"
Smtopps:

Arduino Portenta would run photon

It will not. It’s just not designed for it unfortunately.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-12T01:09:00.013Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":243,"readers_count":242,"score":133.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"marshall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Principal"},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/8","custom_user_title":"Team Principal","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3088219,"name":"bobbysq","username":"bobbysq","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobbysq/{size}/195893_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-12T01:12:34.402Z","cooked":"

In general, I wouldn’t expect PhotonVision to run on anything that can’t run a proper operating system such as Linux. This means no Arduino, no Pixy, no Pi Pico, etc. You’ll want a SBC, not a microcontroller.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2022-10-12T01:12:34.402Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":237,"readers_count":236,"score":197.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":415789,"topic_slug":"installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano","display_username":"bobbysq","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":33408,"username":"Smtopps","name":"Smtopps","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smtopps/{size}/166758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28014,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"he/him"},"post_url":"/t/installing-photonvision-on-a-jetson-nano/415789/9","custom_user_title":"he/him","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3095001,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-07T18:04:02.510Z","cooked":"

I had success get it working with an ELP USB camera on a Nano by following the instructions for installing on Other Debian-Based Co-Processor. I had to install CURL first.

sudo apt update
sudo apt install curl

As noted above, a PiCam didn’t work, only USB cameras.
As far as performance, it seemed to be on par with a LimeLight 2 for AprilTag detection.

performance, it seemed to be on par with a LimeLight 2

I would have guessed Nano to be 10 to 100 times faster judging from all the Internet blogs.

sideways","slug":"yagsl-swerve-is-inverted-sideways","posts_count":7,"reply_count":5,"highest_post_number":7,"image_url":null,"created_at":"2025-02-13T23:01:54.617Z","last_posted_at":"2025-02-14T00:18:23.647Z","bumped":true,"bumped_at":"2025-02-14T00:18:23.647Z","archetype":"regular","unseen":false,"pinned":false,"unpinned":null,"excerpt":"If
